util

Class DirectoryAnalogizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.DirectoryAnalogizer

  • public class DirectoryAnalogizer
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that makes sure that one directory has analogous files to a reference directory. This is useful, for instance, in feature extraction when a user extracts different feature types in different files in same file structures in different directories. In such cases, some extractors might fail and fail to produce files. For later comparisons, it is important to take only those feature representations that have corresponding reference representations - in other words, to take the intersection of all produced corresponding files.

                      java.lang.String[] extensions)
        Deletes files (representations) that do not have a corresponding representation in the reference directory.
        Parameters:
        referenceDir - Validation directory.
        dir - Directory that is being purged of extra files.
        extensions - String[] of all the extensions to consider.
